intro: Dendrocnide ternatensis, commonly known as the Ternate stinging tree, is a shrub or small tree native to the Indo-Pacific region. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that can cause severe skin irritation upon contact. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, often clustered in inflorescences. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, typically in rainforest or coastal areas.
